subject: ??,?: [junit] Run it one by one
msgSnippet: Thx for your help, but where can I call these methods? V. ... ???: Robert Watkins [mailto:robertw@qsipayments.com] ????: 2001?12?18? 8:56 ???:
messageBody:
Thx for your help,
but where can I call these methods?

V.

-----????-----
???: Robert Watkins [mailto:robertw@...]
????: 2001?12?18? 8:56
???: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
??: RE: [junit] Run it one by one


Wenzhe Lu wrote:
> Now I have some trouble. If I have 50 testcase, the JUnit
> always run setup() 50 times firstly, and then run the
> testcase one by one. But I need the JUnit to run ONE setup(),
> one testcase, and the next setup(), the next testcase. How
> can I do it?

The way you say you need it to be done is how JUnit works.

Running an individual test goes like this: (insert exception handling as
needed).
call setUp() method.
call run() method
call tearDown() method

So the sequence _always_ goes: run setup, run test, run next setup, run next
test...

Robert.
